bibl.title: M. L. Coovert v. Clarke County. Motion to Discharge Petitioner
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p:
And Afterwards, to wit: on Tuesday the 13th day of June, 1893, the same being the Judicial day of the Regular June term of said Court, Present the Honorable Cornelius H. Hanford, United States District Judge, presiding, the following proceedings were had in said cause, to wit:
In re M. L. Coovert on Habeas corpus
Now on this day this cause comes on regularly to be heard upon the petition of M. L. Coovert for a writ of habeas corpus and the Court having duly considered the petition and the argument of C. E. S. Wood Esq., counsel for petitioner and of C. D. Bowles Esq., counsel for George Nerton Sheriff and being now sufficiently advised it is ordered that said petition be and the same is hereby granted. And the Clerk of this Court is directed to issue a writ of habeas corpus addressed to George Nerton Sheriff of the County of Clark State of Washington returnable at Seattle June 22, 1893 at ten o'clock A.M.
And afterwards, to wit: on the 22nd day of June 1893 there was duly Filed in said Court, in said cause motion to discharge petitioner in the words and figures as follows, to wit:

In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, Ninth Circuit, Northern Division:
Ex parte M. L. Coovert. } Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Now comes M. L. Coovert, petitioner, by C. E. S. Wood, his solicitor, and on the return of the Sheriff to the writ, moves the Court for an order discharging the petitioner.
C. E. S. Wood Solicitor for M. L. Coovert.

No. 275 In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington
Ex Parte M. L. Coovert Cigarette Case No. 1 Motion to discharge Petitioner
Filed June 22 1893 In the U.S. Circuit Court. A. Reeves Ayres. Clerk By R. M. Hopkings Deputy.
William & Wood Attorneys for Petitioner

And Afterwards, to wit: on the 22nd day of June, 1893, the same being the Judicial day of the Regular June 1893 term of said Court, Present the Honorable Cornelius H. Hanford, United States District Judge, presiding, the following proceedings were had in said cause, to wit:
